questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft Teams Phone deployment.

You are deploying a new remote site.

You have a Session Border Controller (SBC) that has an E1/T1 Primary Rate Interlace (PRI) deployed to the remote site.

You plan to deploy a Survivable Branch Appliance (SBA) to ensure PSTN connectivity.

Which type of endpoints are supported by the SBA?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The correct answer is C. standard SIP devices registered to the SBC.

A Survivable Branch Appliance (SBA) is designed to provide PSTN connectivity and ensure that standard SIP devices registered to the SBC can continue to function even if the connection to the central Microsoft Teams services is lost. This setup ensures that basic telephony services remain available during network outages

D is correct.
The Survivable Branch Appliance (SBA) is designed to ensure continuous access to data and voice services for Microsoft Teams customers in the event of a WAN outage1. The SBA feature is supported on the following Microsoft Teams clients2:

Microsoft Teams Windows desktop
Microsoft Teams macOS desktop
Teams for Mobile
Teams Phones

Selected Answer: D
D is correct
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/direct-routing-survivable-branch-appliance

Selected Answer: D
Repeat question from the old MS-720 exam. Auto Attendant is wrong. D is the correct answer.

The SBA feature is supported on the following Microsoft Teams clients:

Microsoft Teams Windows desktop

Microsoft Teams macOS desktop

Teams for Mobile

Teams Phones

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/direct-routing-survivable-branch-appliance#supported-teams-clients

choices.C: standard SIP devices registered to the SBC

questions.question_text:
Your company uses Microsoft Teams live events.

You assign the Producer role to a user named User1 for an upcoming live event.

What action can User1 perform?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
What Can a Producer Do?
üîπ Start and stop the live event.
üîπ Share video from presenters.
üîπ Share their own video and screen.
üîπ Select which content (video, presentations, or screen sharing) goes live.
üîπ Mute participants and manage audio settings.

Why Not the Other Options?
‚ùå A. Invite attendees ‚Äì Incorrect

Attendees join using a link, and organizers manage invitations.
The Producer does not invite attendees directly.
‚ùå B. Select a production method ‚Äì Incorrect

The event Organizer selects the production method (Teams Encoder or Teams).
The Producer just manages the live event content.
‚ùå D. Set the event group members ‚Äì Incorrect

Only the Organizer can add or modify event group members (Producers, Presenters).

Selected Answer: C
Definitely C - Organizer selects the production method, producer can share participant video.

https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/get-started-with-microsoft-teams-live-events-d077fec2-a058-483e-9ab5-1494afda578a#:~:text=Event%20group%20roles,-Large%20live%20streaming&text=Schedules%20a%20live%20event%20and,Selects%20production%20method.

I go with B.
In Microsoft Teams live events, the Producer role has specific responsibilities and capabilities. Among the options provided, B. Select a production method is the correct action that User1 can perform as a Producer.

Here‚Äôs a brief overview of the other options:

A. Invite attendees: This action is typically performed by the event organizer, not the Producer.
C. Share a participant's video: This action is usually done by the Producer, but it depends on the context of the event. The Producer controls what is shared during the event.
D. Set the event group members: This is also typically the responsibility of the event organizer.
Therefore, the best answer is B. Select a production method.
From Chat GPT.

C is correct!
Based on the roles and responsibilities of a Producer in Microsoft Teams live events, User1 can perform the following action:

C. Share a participant‚Äôs video

As a producer, User1 has the ability to select video feeds from other presenters and send them to the event.

Selected Answer: C
I think it's answer C. https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/get-started-with-microsoft-teams-live-events-d077fec2-a058-483e-9ab5-1494afda578a
It says here that he can do it.

comments.content: I absolutely agree with TekFreak81 as long as the information in the link above is correct. In addition, some say B is correct but "Selects production method." is what Organiser can do, according to the link above.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct.
https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/schedule-a-live-event-in-microsoft-teams-7a9ce97c-e1cd-470f-acaf-e6dfc179a0e2
point 7.

comments.content: Yes, you are right, because "C Sharing PARTICIPANTS videos" is wrong, because producer can choose and share presenters videos, not participants. So correct answer seems B.

choices.C: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, select Voice, select Voice routing policies, and then select Add.
choices.B: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, select Voice, select Dial plan, and then select Add.

questions.question_text:
Your company has offices in 10 countries. The company has a tenant dial plan configured for each country.

The company recently opened an office in a new country.

You need to create a new tenant dial plan that meets the unique dialing requirements of the new country.

What should you do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct.

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have a Teams Phone deployment that contains an office in Mumbai.

The Mumbai office has a new Session Border Controller (SBC) named SBC1 that uses Direct Routing.

Users must be able to use SBC1 only when they are at the Mumbai office.

How should you complete the commands? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content: Given Answer is correct LBR needs to be enabled for this.

Live Events are being replaced by Town Halls from Sep 2024

https://support.microsoft.com/en-au/office/switch-from-microsoft-teams-live-events-to-town-halls-c71bf6e2-ece1-4809-900e-51271f39ac72#:~:text=In%20live%20events%2C%20there%20are,%2C%20presenter%2C%20and%20attendee%20roles.

I would say correct. Point to note the Q/A and registration requirements 

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/quick-start-meetings-live-events
